title: Colab Enterprise - Write code in a Colab Enterprise notebook with Duet AI assistance
abstract:
# Colab Enterprise - Write code in a Colab Enterprise notebook with Duet AI assistance
# Write code in a Colab Enterprise notebook with Duet AI assistance
As an early-stage technology, Duet AI can generate output that seems plausible but is factually incorrect. We recommend that you validate all output from Duet AI before you use it. For more information, see [Duet AI in Google Cloud and responsible AI](/duet-ai/docs/discover/responsible-ai) .
This document describes how you can use [Duet AI](/duet-ai/docs/overview) , an AI-powered collaborator in Google Cloud, to use inline code completion in a Colab Enterprise notebook.
Duet AI doesn't use your prompts or its responses as data to train its model. For more information, see [How Duet AI in Google Cloud uses your data](/duet-ai/docs/discover/data-governance) .
This document is intended for data analysts, data scientists, and data developers who work with Colab Enterprise. It assumes you have knowledge of how to write code in a notebook environment.
content:
## Before you begin
### Required roles
To ensure that your user account has the necessary  permissions to use code completion in a Colab Enterprise notebook,   ask your administrator to grant your user account the   Colab Enterprise User ( [roles/aiplatform.colabEnterpriseUser](/vertex-ai/docs/general/access-control#aiplatform.colabEnterpriseUser) ) IAM role on the project.    For more information about granting roles, see [Manage access](/iam/docs/granting-changing-revoking-access) .
Your administrator might also be able to give your user account  the required permissions through [custom  roles](/iam/docs/creating-custom-roles) or other [predefined  roles](/iam/docs/understanding-roles) .
Users assigned the Code Creator role in a project can list the names of code assets in that project by using the Dataform API or the Dataform command-line interface (CLI). In preview, non-administrators using BigQuery Studio can only see code assets that they created or that were shared with them.
## Write code by using code completion
To use inline code completion in a Colab Enterprise notebook, do the following:
- In the Google Cloud console, go to  the Colab Enterprise **Notebooks** page. [Go to Notebooks](https://console.cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/colab/notebooks) 
- In the **Region** menu, select the region that contains your notebook.
- On the **My notebooks** tab, click the notebook  that you want to open. If you haven't created a notebook yet, [create a notebook](/colab/docs/create-console-quickstart#create) .
- In a code cell of your notebook, start entering code.  Duet AI suggests a potential way to complete your  code in gray italic text.For example, if you enter `import p` ,  Duet AI might suggest a code completion that  imports `pandas as pd` followed by a line that reads a CSV file  and stores the contents in a pandas dataframe. 
- To accept the suggested code completion, press .## What's next
- For information about Duet AI in Google Cloud, read [Duet AI in Google Cloudoverview](/duet-ai/docs/overview) .
- Learn how [Duet AI uses yourdata](/duet-ai/docs/discover/data-governance) .
